final_answer.precision_note: Limiting data are 3 s.f. (0.150 and 23.40 cm3); answer given to 3 s.f.

method: Find moles of NaOH used: rearrange c = n/V to n = cV, with V in dm3. Convert 23.40 cm3 to 0.02340 dm3, so n(NaOH) = 0.150 × 0.02340 = 0.00351 mol. From H2SO4 + 2NaOH → Na2SO4 + 2H2O, 2 mol NaOH react with 1 mol H2SO4, so n(H2SO4) = 0.00351/2 = 0.001755 mol. Convert 25.00 cm3 acid to 0.02500 dm3, then c(H2SO4) = n/V = 0.001755/0.02500 = 0.0702 mol dm-3.
checks: Because 2 mol NaOH neutralize 1 mol H2SO4, the acid concentration should be less than the base concentration, which it is (0.0702 < 0.150).
Volume conversions to dm3 are consistent: 23.40 cm3 = 0.02340 dm3 and 25.00 cm3 = 0.02500 dm3.
